Downsample EEG data

Source: R/signal_processing.R
eeg_downsample.Rd

Downsample a signal_tbl by a factor q, using an FIR or IIR filter. This is a wrapper for decimate from the signal package, see its documentation for details. Notice that the code of the signal package might be outdated.

eeg_downsample(x, q = 2, max_sample = NULL, n = if (ftype == "iir") 8
  else 30, ftype = "iir", multiple_times = FALSE, ...)

Arguments

x

An eeg_lst object.
q

integer factor(s) to downsample by.
max_sample

Optionally, the (approximated) maximum sample number can be defined here, which is at least half of the total number of samples
n

filter order used in the downsampling.
ftype

filter type, "iir" or "fir"
multiple_times

Indicates whether to factorize `q`` and apply the downsampling in steps.
...

Not in use.

Details

A factor q larger than 13 can result in NAs. To avoid this, the downsampling can be done in steps. For example, instead of setting q = 20, it is possible to set q = c(2,10).

Contents

  • Details
